name: Lamotrigine (Lamictal)
summary: An anticonvulsant and mood stabilizer used in bipolar disorder and epilepsy.
description: Lamotrigine is an anticonvulsant that inhibits voltage-sensitive sodium channels, stabilizing neuronal membranes and modulating presynaptic transmitter release of excitatory amino acids such as glutamate and aspartate. In psychiatry, it is widely used for the maintenance treatment of bipolar I disorder, particularly effective for preventing depressive episodes, and has minimal risk of inducing mania. It is also FDA-approved for certain seizure types.

items: Epilepsy (adjunctive or monotherapy for partial seizures, generalized tonic-clonic seizures, Lennox-Gastaut syndrome)

sections.text: Inhibits voltage-gated sodium channels, stabilizing neuronal membranes and modulating release of excitatory neurotransmitters.

adult.bipolar_disorder: Typical target dose 200 mg/day; start 25 mg daily for 2 weeks, then titrate slowly to minimize rash risk.
adult.epilepsy: Varies by regimen and concomitant medications; generally 100–500 mg/day in divided doses.

sections.geriatric: Use lower starting doses and slower titration.
sections.hepatic_impairment: Reduce initial, escalation, and maintenance doses.

items: Orally disintegrating tablets (ODT): 25 mg, 50 mg, 100 mg, 200 mg

sections.text: Mood stabilization benefits may take weeks to months; seizure control onset varies based on titration schedule.

other: Discontinue immediately if rash develops unless clearly non-drug related

items.risk: Increased lamotrigine levels and rash risk

items: Skin for rash during initial months
Seizure frequency if used for epilepsy

sections.pregnancy: Use if benefits outweigh risks; may require dose adjustment during pregnancy.
sections.lactation: Present in breast milk; monitor infant for adverse effects.
sections.pediatrics: Approved for children ≥2 years for epilepsy; bipolar indication is for adults.

sections.text: Taper gradually over at least 2 weeks to reduce seizure risk.

items: Best evidence for preventing bipolar depression rather than mania
Slow titration is essential to reduce rash risk
Minimal weight gain and sexual side effects compared to other mood stabilizers
